page.title: 10PRAWNS FROM WARMINSTER
page.content: Flying Goose is a Warminster-based company with a worldwide reputation for quality frozen food. Founded in 1958 by Mr Jensen and Major Briggs, it first dealt in poultry but now specialises in seafood, mainly prawns (it is the largest such company in the world) and other varieties of fish such as salmon, herring and whitebait. Supplies come direct from Norway, Iceland, and Oriental countries such as India, Thailand and Bangladesh, where they have their own offices and personnel to maintain quality control. There are also export agents in the USA and many other countries. 305 UK staff are employed. Their newest development, a factory in Fairfield Road, opened in 1984. Despite worries about the new by-pass, the company aims to expand, and make its Dan-Maid brand a household name.
